duties_responsibilities.duty: Develop innovative medical devices to treat peripheral, coronary, and heart valve diseases.
Provide oversight to pilot manufacturing/testing and facilitate the transition of products from development to full production.
Participate in cross-functional development teams for process optimization and design support.
Collaborate with research/development, operations, regulatory, and quality teams to develop, validate, and implement various processes.
Analyze, evaluate, and coordinate the procurement of new materials to support prototyping and pilot operation.
Support pilot manufacturing by performing process-related design tasks and ensuring proper documentation.
Identify suppliers, maintain relationships, and ensure component and assembly documentation for new products being developed.
Support company goals and objectives, policies and procedures, Quality Systems, and FDA regulations.
Perform product verification and validation testing, write protocols/reports, and ensure lab notebooks are documented.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical or Biomedical Engineering with 3+ years’ experience in engineering. Master’s degree with 1 year of engineering experience preferred.
